intro: Buphthalmum graveolens, commonly known as the stinking roselin, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a basal rosette of broad, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a white, waxy coating. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense clusters, blooming in late spring to early summer. Buphthalmum graveolens is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
